\begin{tcAthena}
conclude (forall n m k . n = m ==> m = k ==> n + m = m + k)
  pick-any n:Nat m:Nat k:Nat
    assume (n = m)
      assume (m = k)
       # (t = t) always holds by reflexivity, so it can be the first step
       # of a strict chain:
        (!chain-> [(n + n = n + n)
               ==> (n + m = n + m)  [(n = m)]
               ==> (n + m = m + m)  [(n = m)]
               ==> (n + m = m + k)  [(m = k)]])
\end{tcAthena}
